pros:
The work (e.g. mopping, vacuuming, dusting) is not highly taxing on the body.
They give you lots of holidays off and more than a week off during Christmas.

review_title: Low pay, solid benefits, great community
pros: Benefits are good, community is great.
cons: Low pay, job and organizational instability.
No raises in the last 6 years, not very good benefits, questionable leadership, do not contribute to retirement.

pros: They are nice and friendly most of the time

review_title: Excellent Education for Business, Science, and Healthcare
job_title: Associate Professor, College Or University in Wichita, KS
pros: I'll share from what I know: We offer fantastic education in the areas of Business, Science, and Healthcare. I'm sure the same is true in other areas as well.
cons: All universities have their challenges, but I have seen leadership tackling these challenges well and moving us forward.

pros: Faculty are very Flexible with your schedule and caring!
cons: The education is expensive, but worth the time and investment!

pros: It was en easy job. It was not a lot of hours so I could work even while pursuing my undergrad.
cons: It could be a little chaotic sometimes

pros:
Closely work with both the Partners.
NT is a small group at this time and all colleagues are friendly and help each other and work as a team. Managers take care for the less experienced staff and help them advance in their career by providing good feedback and share some of their learning experience.
cons: Remote working and flexibility are rare. In spite of remote network connections in these modern days, employees are rarely permitted to work remotely.

job_title: Help Desk & Classroom Tech Coordinator in Wichita, KS
pros: Working with enthusiastic and committed students. Sharing in making them successful not only in their academic pursuits but also helping them develop the soft skills that aren’t addressed in their classrooms.
cons: Administration not listening to the actual needs of the faculty and staff working in the trenches. However, administrators turn over every few years so there is always room for improvement.

review_title: Horrible environment for staff - poorly run by leadership.
pros: Professors seem to care about students. Most students receive a solid education. Benefits are good for those that have worked there long-term.
cons: President does not care about staff, some departments are treated with extreme disrespect. Everyone is underpaid except the cabinet members. Many employees and management are allowed to get away with awful treatment of their peers and employees with no consequences. Quite a few employees don't do their job at all.

pros: Great staff, support your through the learning process on the job. Great working hours and are able to fit around your time schedule.
cons: Doesn't have the most interesting and intriguing work, and sometimes it is hard to stay motivated whilst working.

review_title: Fantastic school with lots of opportunity, as well as a friendly campus
pros: Newman University allows students to work on campus to help pay for personal expenses. Some jobs are suited for said students particular field, others are more general
cons: The minimum wage is too low, at $7.25 and being a private catholic institution, a higher minimum wage could easily be doable

pros: Loved the environment around Newman. The size of the campus brings all students and faculty even closer which makes this experience even better.
cons: Some building are very old and have a lot of maintenance problems. Merlini Hall is very old school. With old thermostats and mold in most rooms.

review_title: Great community, great faculty, poor management
pros: Quality, forward-thinking faculty to collaborate with,  improvements all over campus to infrastructure, small student-faculty ratio
cons: No accountability for or follow through from management,  lack of foresight, lack of communication

review_title: It has been a satisfying job
pros: The coworkers can be great if you are looking at the ones outside of your office
cons: There is no recognition for a job well done

pros: Small school with dedicated and personalized educational program.
cons: Expensive private school. Graduate assistantship only covers 6 credit hours. Old-school mindset. Poor budgeting application and distribution.

pros: Strong values, good benefits, great students
